009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
018
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
022import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver;
023
024/**
025 * Algebraic ellipse fit based on Taubin's method [1].
026 * Version 2 uses a reduced scatter and constraint matrix (5x5).
027 * solution is found by a generalized symmetric eigenproblem.
028 * Performs data centering or alternatively accepts a specific reference point.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2021/11/09
032 */
033public class EllipseFitTaubin2 implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
034        
035        private final double[] p;       // p = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
036        
037        public EllipseFitTaubin2(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
038                if (points.length < 5) {
039                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 5 points must be supplied for ellipse fitting");
040                }
041                this.p = fit(points, xref);
042                
043        }
044        
045        public EllipseFitTaubin2(Pnt2d[] points) {
046                this(points, PntUtils.centroid(points));
047        }
048
049        @Override
050        public double[] getParameters() {
051                return this.p;
052        }
053        
054        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
055        
056        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
057                final int n = points.length;
058                
059                // reference point
060                final double xr = xref.getX();
061                final double yr = xref.getY();
062
063                // design matrix (same as Fitzgibbon):
064                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 6);
065                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
066                        final double x = points[i].getX() - xr; // center data set
067                        final double y = points[i].getY() - yr;
068                        double[] fi = {sqr(x), x*y, sqr(y), x, y, 1};
069                        X.setRow(i, fi);
070                }
071                
072                // scatter matrix S (normalized by 1/n)
073                RealMatrix S = X.transpose().multiply(X).scalarMultiply(1.0/n);
074//              IJ.log("M = \n" + imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.toString(S.getData()));
075                
076                RealMatrix S1 = S.getSubMatrix(0, 4, 0, 4);
077//              IJ.log("S1 = \n" + imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.toString(S1.getData()));
078                
079                RealVector s5 = S.getColumnVector(5).getSubVector(0, 5);
080//              IJ.log("s5 = " + imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.toString(s5.toArray()));
081
082                RealMatrix P = S1.subtract(s5.outerProduct(s5));
083//              IJ.log("P = \n" + imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.toString(P.getData()));
084        
085                double a = S.getEntry(0, 5);
086                double b = S.getEntry(2, 5);
087                double c = S.getEntry(1, 5);
088                double d = S.getEntry(3, 5);
089                double e = S.getEntry(4, 5);
090                
091                // constraint matrix:
092                RealMatrix Q = Matrix.makeRealMatrix(5, 5, 
093                                4*a, 2*c, 0,   2*d, 0,
094                                2*c, a+b, 2*c, e,   d, 
095                                0,   2*c, 4*b, 0,   2*e,
096                                2*d, e,   0,   1,   0,
097                                0,   d,   2*e, 0,   1);
098                
099                GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver eigen = new GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver(P, Q);
100                
101                double[] evals = eigen.getRealEigenvalues();
102//              IJ.log("evals = " + Arrays.toString(evals));
103                
104                int k = getSmallestPositiveIdx(evals);
105                RealVector q0 = eigen.getEigenVector(k);
106//              IJ.log("pInit = " + Matrix.toString(pInit.toArray()));
107                
108                double f = -s5.dotProduct(q0);
109                RealVector qopt = q0.append(f);
110                
111                RealMatrix U = getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(xr, yr);
112                double[] q = U.operate(qopt.toArray());
113                return Matrix.normalize(q);
114        }
115        
116        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
117        
118        private int getSmallestPositiveIdx(double[] x) {
119                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
120                int minidx = -1;
121                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
122                        if (x[i] >= 0 && x[i] < minval) {
123                                minval = x[i];
124                                minidx = i;
125                        }
126                }
127                return minidx;
128        }
129        
130        private static double TOLERANCE = 1e-6;
131        
132        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
133        private boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {      
134                try {
135                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, TOLERANCE, TOLERANCE);
136                        return true;
137                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
138                
139                return false;
140        }
141        
142
143
144}
